lines.text: Maybe they had more candles? Like a lot of them? Really really flammable candles?
Well, first off, those are called fireworks, and I don't think the wizards had-
Nah, nah, I was just messing with you.
But for real- whatever it was, it burned hot enough to melt those four candles in a few minutes.
That's... not hard. They're wax. Wax melts real quick. Kind of the point.
Wait, huh? But... candles burn down really slowly.
As designed. The candle flame liquefies a little bit of wax, and the wick uses capillary action to draw the wax to the flame.
The wax ordinarily doesn't have enough contact with the air to combust, but, well...
The wick's structure increases the surface area of melted wax exposed to the air, allowing it to burn.
Also, you managed to get through that whole explanation without stuttering, so... congrats?
